<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/46f479c756c0255e3b6d473590c1857678eff5c6|patch 8.2.1965: Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature>
patch 8.2.1965: Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature

Problem:    Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature.
Solution:   Check if the channel feature is present. (Dominique Pellé,
            closes 7270)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1965: Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature · vim/vim@46f479c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1965: Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature · vim/vim@46f479c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: tests fail without the channel feature. Solution: Check if the channel feature is present. (Dominique Pellé, closes 7270)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/faebda8cc1ecc4d6a197e06e968df46a2841ed79|patch 8.2.1964: not all ConTeXt files are recognized>
patch 8.2.1964: not all ConTeXt files are recognized

Problem:    Not all ConTeXt files are recognized.
Solution:   Add two patterns. (closes #7263)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/927495b1fef835a8f83c089bb3aa3608b617e972|patch 8.2.1963: crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding>
patch 8.2.1963: crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding

Problem:    Crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding.
Solution:   Don't use ScreenLinesUC when enc_utf8 is false. (closes #7241)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1963: crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding · vim/vim@927495b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1963: crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding · vim/vim@927495b
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using a popup window with "latin1" encoding. Solution: Don't use ScreenLinesUC when enc_utf8 is false. (closes #7241)
